Why the I.R.A. Stopped Talking
nytimes_articles.abstract:
The Irish peace process is in ruins. 

     The Irish Republican Army is back, killing at random on the streets of London. With yet another bomb explosion in the city on Sunday, the I.R.A. is staging a spectacular and ignominious return to terrorism, threatening to expand the attacks to other English cities.

The Unwilling Witness
nytimes_articles.abstract:
Warren Moon, the Minnesota Vikings' star quarterback, was arrested and charged with assault last summer after an alleged altercation with his wife, Felicia. Now his home state, Texas, adamantly wants him convicted. His wife, equally adamantly, does not. 

     Mrs. Moon did everything she could to stay off the witness stand. But a recent change in Texas law permits the state to force her to testify against her husband, despite a longstanding principle that spouses have the right not to testify against one another.

Building Cooking Expertise, A Meal (or Two) at a Time
nytimes_articles.abstract:
MY husband, who periodically vows to help fix dinner, had to make good on his word not long ago when I went out of town. With our 13-year-old daughter, we planned the menus and included four of her favorite dinners. 

     When I spoke to my daughter about 10 P.M. in the middle of the first week, I  could hear the clanking of dishes being washed. Michael claimed to be managing the recipes quite well but was still busy cleaning up because cooking three separate dishes -- steamed broccoli, sauteed chicken and mashed potatoes -- set  him back by a couple of hours.

Embryo Research Is 'Pro-Life'
nytimes_articles.abstract:
When President Clinton put his pen to the latest stopgap spending measure, he also signed into law a temporary ban on Federal financing of human embryo research. The restriction, which lasts until Sept. 30, serves no moral purpose and is a serious setback in the fight against birth defects, hereditary diseases and possibly cancer. 

     The ban was inserted as a sweetener to conservative Republicans. Apparently,  G.O.P. boosters of "family values" chose to ignore the most immediate application of embryo research: helping couples with fertility problems start families.

What Buchanan Owes Clinton
nytimes_articles.abstract:
Patrick J. Buchanan's stump speeches calling for trade protectionism have taken on a life of their own even though they have been denounced by most mainstream policy wonks and politicians. He has used the issue to win the New Hampshire primary and has found that even Senator Bob Dole has borrowed part of  his platform. 

     Yet Mr. Buchanan's specific prescriptions owe much to those very wonks and politicians -- many in the Clinton Administration -- who find his agenda appalling. He found the ammunition for his campaign without difficulty in his opponents' backyards.
